context.description: This command toggles a breakpoint's suspend policy between suspending all threads in a VM or only the thread in which the breakpoint was encountered.

topic.label: Exception Breakpoint Suspend on Subclass Option

context.description: This command opens a dialog to configure a breakpoint's hit count.
This command opens a dialog to configure a breakpoint's properties.
When checked, this command configures an exception breakpoint to suspend execution in caught locations.

topic.label: Exception Breakpoint Suspend on Subclass Option

context.description: When checked, this command configures an exception breakpoint to suspend execution in uncaught locations.

topic.label: Exception Breakpoint Suspend on Subclass Option

context.description: When checked, this command configures a method breakpoint to suspend execution when a method is entered.
When checked, this command configures a method breakpoint to suspend execution when a method is exited.
You can paste, format, and navigate Java stack traces in this console.
This command allows you to quickly toggle the stacktrace auto-format option. When on, all Java stacktraces pasted into the console will automatically be formatted for you.
Select this command to format the text in the console as a Java stack trace. Formatting will fix whitespace problems and add links where possible.
This command launches the selected main type as a Java application.
This command launches the selected applet in an applet viewer.
This command toggles the display of non-suspended system threads.
This command toggles the display of owned monitors and monitors being waiting on by each suspended thread in the debug view.
This command toggles the display of thread groups in the debug view.
This command creates a step filter for the package associated with the receiver of the selected stack frame.
This command creates a step filter for the type associated with the receiver of the selected stack frame.
This command opens the Java step filters preference page.
This dialog allows you to add an exception breakpoint.

topic.label: Exception Breakpoint Suspend on Subclass Option

context.description: This dialog allows you to configure the location, name, and libraries associated with a JRE. Source and javadoc can be configured for each library.
This dialog allows you to view the read-only properties of a JRE contributed by a plug-in.
This dialog allows you to configure the detail formatter code snippet associated with a Java class.
This dialog allows you to configure the logical structure code snippet associated with a Java class.
This dialog allows you to configure the imports associated with a snippet editor.
This dialog allows you to select a class with the main method you wish to launch.
This dialog allows you to change the value of a Java object by creating an expression that will be evaluated to generate the value.
This dialog allows you to change the value of a Java String by entering literal text or by creating an expression that will be eveluated to generate the value.
This dialog allows you to input a new value for a variable.
This dialog allows you to restrict breakpoints to only suspend execution when they are in specific Java object instances.
This view displays the result of expression evaluations. It allows you to select an expression and evaluate it.
This command clears the contents of the Display view.
This tab allows you to specify the program and virtual machine arguments for the launch associated with this launch configuration as well as the working directory
This tab allows you to specify the classpath for the launch associated with this launch configuration
This tab allows you to set specific information for remote debugging
This tab allows you to define the JRE used to run or debug the application
This tab allows you specify parameters associated with the main type for the launch.
This wizard helps you create a new Java scrapbook page.
This component allows you to change the default working directory.
This tab allows you to specify the applet viewer parameters for the launch associated with this launch configuration
This tab allows you specify parameters associated with the applet for the launch.
This tab allows you to specify the program and virtual machine arguments for the launch associated with this launch configuration as well as the working directory
This command opens a Type Hierarchy view on the type of the selected object.
This command opens a Java editor on the type of the selected object.
This command opens a Type Hierarchy view on the declared type of the selected variable.
This command opens a Java editor on the declared type of the selected variable.
This command opens a Java editor on the type of the receiver of the selected stack frame.
This command opens a Type Hierarchy view on the type of the receiver of the selected stack frame.
This command opens a Java editor on the type in which the method of the selected stack frame is defined.
This command opens a Type Hierarchy view on the type in which the method of the selected stack frame is defined.
On this page, you can configure Java debugging preferences for suspending execution, hot code replace, and communication timeouts.
On this page, you can define code snippets used to display the details for variables and expressions in the Variables and Expressions view details area.
This page allows you to configure heap walking settings for Java 1.6 SE vms
On this page, you can configure logical structure displays for variables in the Java debugger.
On this page, you can configure display options for primitive variables in the Java debugger.
On this page, you can configure the step filters for the Java debugger.
On this page, you can add, remove, and edit JRE configurations.
On this page, you can specify a default JRE to use for each JRE profile.
On this page, you can modify the properties of a Java breakpoint.
This page displays optional debug capabilities of the selected VM.

This page allows you to configure the selected breakpoint. Enablement restricts when this breakpoint will suspend execution. Hit count sets the number of times this breakpoint must be reached before suspending execution.
This page allows you to restrict the breakpoint to only suspend execution in specific threads.

This page allows you to configure an exception breakpoint. Caught and uncaught options allow you to change the circumstances in which the breakpoint will suspend execution. You can also change the suspend policy determining what actions to take when an exception occurs.
This page allows you to select or define breakpoint filters for Java exception breakpoints. A filter can be selected, or you can define an expression using the Add button.

This page allows you to configure the selected breakpoint. Line breakpoints can have enablement conditions, which are snippets of code that must return a boolean value determining when this breakpoint should suspend execution. Watchpoints can choose to suspend on field access or modification.
This command opens a dialog to create a Java exception breakpoint.
This command steps into the selected method on the current line of execution. Method selection is determined by the selected text or cursor location in the Java editor.
This command resumes execution to the line on which the cursor is located in the Java editor.
This command forces the selected frame to return the value of the selected code snippet without executing any more instructions in the method.
This command executes the selected code snippet.
This command executes the selected code snippet and displays a textual result.
This command executes the selected code snippet and shows the resulting object or primitive in the Expressions view.
This command creates a watch item for the selected text or variable, and places it in the Expressions view.
This command allows you to add a class load breakpoint to a selected type.
This command adds or removes a watchpoint on the selected field.
This command adds or removes a method breakpoint on the selected method.
This command adds or removes a breakpoint on the current line.
This command opens a dialog to configure the imports associated with this snippet editor.
This command terminates the VM performing evaluations for this snippet editor.
This option can be toggled to show or hide qualified names in the view.
This option can be toggled to show or hide constants (static final variables) in the view.
This option can be toggled to show or hide static variables in the view.
This command adds the selected object or primitive value to the Expressions view.
This command creates a Java watch expression based on the name of the selected variable.
This command opens a dialog to define a detail formatter for the class of the selected variable.
This command opens a dialog to edit an existing detail formatter for the class of the selected variable.
This command removes the existing detail formatter for the class of the selected variable.
Opens preference pages to configure settings related to variables in the Java debugger.
Displays all of the instances of the currently selected object in the variables view
Opens a popup displaying all objects referencing the selected object.

Toggles the display of references in the view. When turned on, each Java object that supports references will have a new child item with the name "'[variable name]' referenced from:". This new variable contains a list of all Java objects that refer to the parent object.
This option can be toggled to show or hide null array entries in the view.
This command opens a dialog that allows you to filter breakpoints to specific Java object instances.
